Short-Term Power Trader - Balancing Expert
description:
Company Description
  
Mega, part of MET GROUP, is recruiting a **Short\\-term Power Trader** **/ Balancing Expert** to develop its short\\-term trading desk in Belgium\\- with the scope extended to the **Benelux** and the Power and Gas market.


You will **optimize** MEGA portfolio’s real\\-time positions on spot markets (day\\-ahead, intraday) to ensure reliable and competitively priced energy for MEGA’s customers, while supporting the company’s commitment to **fair pricing, transparency, andmarket optimization** . This role operates in a highly dynamic environment **where rapid analysis and decisive action** are essential.


  
Job Description
  
**What you will do ?**

* **Trading \\& Portfolio Optimization** :



	+ Create and apply short\\-term‑ trading approaches aimed at maximizing revenue and minimizing operational costs.
	+ Manage Balancing operations.
	+ Optimize nominations, flexibility, and consumption/production forecasts across MEGA’s portfolio.
	+ Identify arbitrage opportunities aligned with MEGA’s commercial strategy.
	+ Reduce imbalance costs by adjusting positions in real time.
* **Asset Optimization (Production, BESS)** :



	+ Support the evaluation, structuring, and optimization of BESS and production\\-related initiatives (value creation, arbitrage/imbalance. services, ancillary services, hedging alignment).
	+ Coordinate internal stakeholders (Trading, Risk, Operations, Legal, Finance) to ensure operational feasibility and compliance.
	+ Define and track performance KPIs (availability, cycle efficiency, revenues vs. model, constraints) and drive continuous improvement post go\\-live.
* **Market Analysis \\& Decision\\-Making** :



	+ Monitor Belgian and European fundamentals: weather, renewable output, grid constraints, demand patterns, gas and CO₂ prices.
	+ Analyze deviations between forecasts and actuals to improve internal forecasting models.
	+ Use MEGA’s data\\-driven tools and internal models to support trading decisions.
	+ Commit to continuous improvement by staying up to date with the latest technologies and trading strategies.
* **Compliance \\& Risk Management** :



	+ Operate within MEGA’s risk limits and comply with Belgian and European regulations (REMIT, EMIR, Elia balancing rules).
	+ Ensure full traceability of decisions and transactions.
	+ Help strengthen processes and controls in an agile, evolving organization.

You will report to the Sourcing Manager.


**Why join?**

* You will work in a **challenging environment**
* You will contribute to making energy **more affordable** for hundreds of thousands of customers
* You will help MEGA conquer the **B2B market in the Benelux**
* You will join the dynamic Sourcing team of MEGA
* **Fast\\-growing international group with career development opportunities in Europe.**
* Based in the heart of **Liege or Leuven** , this full\\-time role offers a **competitive salary package** aligned with your extensive experience and qualifications.

  
Qualifications
  
**Is this job made for you?**

* **Education** : Master’s degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, Economics or related fields
* **Experience** : **5\\+ years** in intraday and short\\-term optimization power trading, expertise in flexible asset management is a strong plus
* **Language** :



	+ Fluent in **English**
	+ Knowledge of **French and/or Dutch** is a plus
* **Technical** :



	+ **Programming skills** in **SQL, Power BI or similar**
	+ Solid understanding of **Belgian and European power markets** (gas market is a \\+)
	+ Experience with **ETRM systems or internal trading tools**
* **Personal** :



	+ Strong **analytical mindset** and **comfort with real\\-time data**
	+ High level of **rigor, reliability** , and **attention to detail**
	+ Strong communication skills and a **collaborative mindset**
	+ Motivation to contribute to a Belgian scale\\-up with a **pragmatic, impact\\-driven culture.**

  
Additional Information

title: Analyst, Marketing & Trading
description:
Job Description
AltaGas \\- Analyst, Marketing \\& Trading
Reporting into AltaGas’s Midstream Division, the Scheduling Analyst will support the vessel exports, rail, and trucking logistics team and will be primarily responsible for ensuring accurate and timely scheduling of vessels and rail cars in Allegro, AltaGas's ETRM system.
You will:* Work collaboratively with the commercial and logistics teams to ensure vessel, rail and truck transactions are scheduled in Allegro (ETRM) daily
* Ensure positions are ready to be actualized and settled/invoiced by the Accounting team based on third\\-party statements, BOLs, or best available information
* Ensure Allegro positions are accurate, including planned, forecasted, nominated, and actual volumes through a daily reconciliation process
* Ensure timely and accurate entry of all deals into Allegro
* Support \\& resolve daily risk reporting discrepancies and support end\\-of\\-day (EOD) sign\\-off activities
* Continually evaluating the Allegro process to identify efficiencies and create optimizations
* Provide issue resolution to support settlement/invoicing, liaising between Accounting, Logistics, and Commercial


You have:* Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel, Word, and Outlook
* Experience with Allegro would be an asset
* Strong attention to detail, proven ability to prioritize, multi\\-task, and meet critical deadlines
* Superior oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills
* Motivated individual able to work independently and as a team player
* Bachelor’s degree in commerce, Economics, Finance or related


Why AltaGas?
Joining AltaGas means becoming part of a team that values growth, innovation, and meaningful impact. You’ll gain exposure to global LPG markets and real‑time commercial activities, benefit from professional development through mentorship and continuous learning, and be supported by a culture focused on safety, sustainability, and continuous improvement—all while contributing to energy supply strategy in a dynamic and evolving environment.
\\#LI\\-KG1
For Canadian hires: AltaGas hires personnel on the basis of job\\-related qualifications. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to a person's ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, record of offences, marital status, family status or disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.
For U.S. hires: WGL/SEMCO/AltaGas offers a total rewards package that includes competitive pay, incentive bonus plans, holiday pay, 401K matching and a wide array of benefits. These benefits including medical, dental and vision coverage are designed to help you and your family stay healthy. We also have paid time off (PTO) to balance the demands of your work and personal life. Available benefits vary depending upon the specifics of the role.
U.S. affiliates of AltaGas are committed to equal employment opportunity and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. We value and encourage diversity and solicit applications from all qualified applicants without regard to race, ethnicity, religion, gender, age, national origin, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, family responsibilities, matriculation, physical or mental disabilities, political affiliation, genetic information, status as a protected veteran or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.
company_description: We are a North American energy infrastructure company.

title: Senior Analyst - Superior Gas Liquids
description:
**What we will offer you:**  

**Culture:** Join a supportive and inclusive work environment where teamwork, respect, and open communication are at the core of everything we do.
  
**Opportunity:** A continuous focus on professional development with many opportunities for training \\& career growth.
  
**Health \\& Wellness:** Competitive health benefits right from the start including health \\& wellness spending accounts \\& maternity leave top\\-up. Access our employee assistance program for confidential counseling, mental health support, and various resources to help you navigate life’s challenges.
  
**Competitive Compensation:** We offer a highly competitive salary package, ensuring that your hard work and dedication are recognized and rewarded accordingly.
  
**Flexibility:** We understand the importance of work\\-life balance, we offer flexible hybrid work options to help you manage your personal and professional commitments.
  
**Technology:** Work with state\\-of\\-the\\-art tools and technologies that empower you to excel in your role and stay at the forefront of industry trends.
  
**Safety Focused:** We care about you and have committed to a zero\\-harm workplace.
  
  

We are seeking an experienced and highly analytical professional to join our team as a Senior NGL Analyst. In this crucial role, you will be responsible for analyzing market trends, forecasting supply and demand, and preparing, maintaining, and distributing daily commodity marketing pricing reports. This is a challenging and rewarding opportunity for a highly skilled and motivated individual to play a pivotal role in our NGL marketing operations.
  
  

**What you’ll do:**  

* Conduct in\\-depth market research and analysis to identify trends, opportunities, and risks in the NGL markets, including propane and butane.
* Develop accurate supply and demand forecasts for NGLs by analyzing production data, storage levels, import/export figures, and other relevant factors.
* Collaborate with the commercial team to develop pricing strategies, and optimize the distribution of NGL price offerings.
* Build and maintain complex financial models to evaluate potential deals, assess profitability, and support decision\\-making processes.
* Monitor and analyze competitors' pricing and sales activities, market dynamics, and regulatory changes to identify potential impacts on our business.
* Prepare comprehensive reports, presentations, and recommendations for senior management, highlighting key findings and actionable insights.
* Collaborate with cross\\-functional teams, including accounting, sales, supply, and logistics, to ensure seamless coordination and efficient operations.


**What you bring:**  

* Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Engineering, or a related quantitative field; Master's degree is preferred.
* Minimum of 5 years of experience in the energy industry, with a strong focus on Midstream Analytics, NGL marketing, trading, or related areas.
* Excellent analytical and quantitative skills, with proficiency in data analysis, modeling, and forecasting techniques.
* Strong understanding of NGL markets, pricing mechanisms, and industry dynamics.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex information clearly and concisely.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite, particularly Excel and Power BI, and experience with SQL, Azure, Databricks, Python, as well as experience with advanced modelling, and working with large datasets is preferred.
* Experience with RightAngle, or other ETRM systems preferred.
* Ability to work in a fast\\-paced, dynamic environment and handle multiple priorities simultaneously.
* Strong problem\\-solving skills and a proactive approach to identifying and addressing challenges.
* Familiarity with supply chain optimization and logistics management would be considered an asset.


**Salary:** $80,221 \\- $100,276 annually (based on skills, experience, qualifications, and geography).
  
Eligible employees may earn performance\\-based incentives and have access to comprehensive benefits and retirement plans with matching contributions.
  
  

This posting is a replacement for an existing vacancy. We do not use AI tools in the selection process and do not request pay history.
  
  

Superior Gas Liquids (SGL) provides tailored solutions to wholesale customers to move propane and butane throughout North America. SGL is the sole supplier to Superior Propane; Canada's largest and only coast to coast propane distributor.
  
  

"Here at Superior Gas Liquids we are an equal opportunity employer committed to the inclusion and accommodation of all individuals. If you have an accommodation need during the recruitment \\& selection process, we encourage you to connect with us at aoda\\_hr@superiorpropane.com to let us know how we can enhance your experience."
company_description: Our Superior values – respect, integrity, service and excellence – result in a team committed to delivering exceptional customer service.

title: Analyst, Commercial Systems, Power BI
description:
**Description**


**As of November 1, 2025, Sunoco LP has successfully completed its acquisition of Parkland Corporation.** For more information, please visit www.sunocolp.com.

**Competitive Benefits. Meaningful Extras. Unmatched Value.**

* A place where you can take your career in the direction you want to grow and go

**Starting Salary: $65,000\\-$85,000 per annum**

**The Opportunity:**


The Power BI Analyst will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets and data flows, as well as designing and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to deliver actionable insights and recommendations to business partners.


The Power BI Analyst will collaborate with cross\\-functional teams to support data\\-driven projects and ensure the accuracy of reporting solutions. They will also manage Power BI workspaces, documentation libraries, and collaboration tools such as Confluence and JIRA, designing and developing process automation and data intake solutions by leveraging Power Apps and Power Automate. In addition, they will oversee the ongoing development and maintenance of business intelligence (BI) reporting and analytical solutions.

**Responsibilities:**


Reporting and Analysis

* Design, develop, and maintain interactive Power BI dashboards and reports that clearly communicate data insights to business stakeholders.
* Write complex SQL queries to extract, manipulate, and analyze data from multiple sources.
* Optimizing Power BI semantic models for scalability and efficient performance.
* Design, develop and manage Power Automate workflows to streamline reporting processes and leverage Power Apps to create intuitive applications for data entry and management.
* Ensure data quality and governance by maintaining high standards of data accuracy, consistency, and reliability across all reporting solutions, document business rules and data definitions to support governance and compliance.
* Partner with cross\\-functional teams to gather requirements and translate business needs into reporting solutions, and present actionable insights that support data driven decision making.
* Contribute to BI migration initiatives from legacy systems to new ETRM and SAP ERP platforms and collaborating with technical and business teams to validate migrated data and ensure reporting accuracy.


Continuous Improvement

* Stay updated on Power BI, Microsoft Fabric, Power Platform, and data visualization best practices.
* Identify gaps and opportunities for improvement and automate manual reporting processes to optimize workflows and reduce operational costs.
* Contribute to building and advancing data\\-driven culture across the commercial division.

**Education:**

* Post\\-secondary degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Data Analytics would be an asset, however relevant experience or education would also be considered.

**Requirements:**

* Minimum 3 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar analytical role.
* Experience in creating dashboards and reports using Power BI and validating results with business stakeholders.
* Ability to query data and draft reports using Power Query (M), DAX, and SQL are mandatory.
* Proficiency in developing solutions using Power Platform (Power Automate \\& Power Apps) for process improvement and efficiency.
* Experience in creating and managing dataflows to support scalable and efficient data integration.
* Experience in using Confluence as a documentation library for knowledge sharing and collaboration.
* Experience in working with JIRA or similar project management tools.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills along with the ability to work well in cross\\-functional teams.
* Ability to adjust to changing and conflicting demands, responsibilities, and issues.
* Understanding of Agile methodology, project management principles and emerging AI technologies.
* The ideal candidate should be flexible and willing to travel as part of their role.

**Preferred qualifications:**  

* Experience with Python, R, and Databricks
* Experience in the oil and gas industry.
* Experience working with ETRM and ERP Systems (Right Angle \\& SAP)
**Humble. Hungry. Smart. Does this sound like you?**


Do others describe you as being a down\\-to\\-earth achiever? Someone who thinks outside the box and always strives to do more than what is required? Someone who sees the bigger picture? You sound brilliant to work with!

**We Want You To Shine:**


We are committed to providing equal opportunities to all applicants. If you require accommodation due to a disability, you will have an opportunity to notify us when scheduling your interview.

**Belonging Matters. Because You Do:**


We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from all qualified individuals. Our ability to work as one team across Canada, the United States, and the Caribbean is foundational to our success. We show up as our authentic selves each day and create space for one another’s unique contributions.


We respect the diverse cultures, traditions, and perspectives of Indigenous Peoples and seek to achieve equitable partnerships and opportunities with Indigenous communities.

**The Fine Print:**


Candidates must be legally eligible to work in the country in which they applied. Regrettably, we are unable to sponsor employment visas at this time.


Final candidates will be required to undergo a confidential pre\\-employment background check, including but not limited to educational, criminal, credit, drug and alcohol, and/or fitness for duty testing.


\\#LI\\-AD1
company_description: Powering Journeys and Energizing Communities. We're a passionate team of down-to-earth achievers, committed to getting our customers, colleagues and communities further, faster.

title: Analyst, Supply & Trading - West
description:
**A little about Capital Power**

Capital Power (TSX: CPX) is dedicated to *Powering Change by Changing Power* . This north star guides our ambitions, focus, and actions as we transform our energy system. We're a growth\\-oriented North American energy company headquartered in Edmonton, Alberta. Our team safely delivers, builds, and creates balanced energy solutions for customers across North America.


Our people are at the core of our journey to deliver reliable, affordable, and lower\\-carbon power solutions. We provide purpose\\-driven work in a safe and inclusive environment, and we live by our North Star . With us, your contributions matter – we want you to be empowered to innovate, collaborate, and ultimately drive results. We're here to partner with you so you can learn, grow, and forge a career that's meaningful to you. Join us in powering North America!


**Your Opportunity**

One Permanent Full Time Position.  



The Analyst, Supply \\& Trading supports Capital Power’s trading desk by providing market analysis, risk assessment, and insights for the Western Electricity Coordinating Council (WECC) and California Independent System Operator (CAISO) power and gas markets. This role ensures accurate forecasting, compliance, and execution strategies to optimize portfolio performance and profitability.  



**You will contribute to our team by:**

**Market Analysis \\& Forecasting:**

* Monitor and project pricing for WECC and CAISO power and gas markets
* Analyze supply/demand fundamentals, transmission constraints, and weather impacts.

**Trading Support:**

* Provide actionable insights to traders for day\\-ahead and real\\-time positions.
* Assist in developing hedging strategies and optimizing asset dispatch.

**Risk Management \\& Compliance:**

* Ensure adherence to Capital Power’s risk policies and regulatory requirements.
* Track exposure and report P\\&L impacts to management.

**Data \\& Reporting:**

* Maintain accurate market data and develop dashboards for performance tracking.
* Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly market summaries for internal stakeholders.

**Collaboration:**

* Work closely with traders, schedulers, and risk teams to align strategies.
* Support cross\\-functional initiatives related to portfolio optimization.

**What you will bring to the role**

**Education:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, Engineering, or related field.

**Experience:**

* 2\\+ years of experience in energy trading, analytics, or power/gas markets.
* Proficiency in data analysis tools (Excel, SQL, Python preferred).
* Excellent communication and problem\\-solving skills.

**Technical \\& Social Process Skills:**

* Experience with ETRM systems and ISO scheduling platforms.
* Knowledge of renewable integration and congestion management strategies.

**Working Conditions:**

* In\\-office position with limited travel required
* Location: Calgary

**Additional Details:**

In order to be considered for this role you must be legally eligible to work in Canada.


The successful candidate for this position will undergo an education verification, reference checks and criminal record check.  



We believe that creating a culture that supports employee physical, mental, financial, and social wellbeing is critical to our success. That is why we provide flexible and affordable employee benefits, retirement savings, and paid time off programs. We also provide comprehensive onboarding, training, and programs supporting your career development.


Depending on the posting requirements relocation assistance may be available.


**How To Apply and Next Steps**

Capital Power only accepts resumes via online application at www.capitalpower.com/careers . If you choose to submit your resume by any other means, we cannot guarantee that your application will be considered for vacancies.
  

  

Applicants with disabilities who require a reasonable accommodation to complete their application can request accessible formats, communication support, or other accessibility assistance by contacting careers@capitalpower.com .
  

  

Capital Power is committed to providing a fair and transparent hiring process. We recognize and embrace the value of diversity and hire employees with the appropriate skills, experience and knowledge for each position.
  

  

Thank you for taking the time to apply and expressing interest in powering a sustainable future with Capital Power! We wish that we could personally respond to everyone who applies; however, it is our practice to contact only those individuals selected for interviews.

title: Accounting Specialist – Trading Finance
description:
**A little about Capital Power**

Capital Power (TSX: CPX) is dedicated to *Powering Change by Changing Power* . This north star guides our ambitions, focus, and actions as we transform our energy system. We're a growth\\-oriented North American energy company headquartered in Edmonton, Alberta. Our team safely delivers, builds, and creates balanced energy solutions for customers across North America.


Our people are at the core of our journey to deliver reliable, affordable, and lower\\-carbon power solutions. We provide purpose\\-driven work in a safe and inclusive environment, and we live by our North Star . With us, your contributions matter – we want you to be empowered to innovate, collaborate, and ultimately drive results. We're here to partner with you so you can learn, grow, and forge a career that's meaningful to you. Join us in powering North America!


**Your Opportunity**

One Permanent Full Time Position.


We’re growing and are currently seeking an innovative and results\\-oriented individual to join our Trading and Origination Accounting team!


We are seeking a highly motivated Accounting Specialist to join our dynamic team at Capital Power. As an Accounting Specialist – Trading Finance, you will play a vital role in supporting our growing energy trading business by ensuring accounting results and cash flow at the transactional level accurately represent the trading activity through a combination of accounting and analytical skills, business understanding, leveraging technology, and collaboration with multiple teams and customers. The scope of the role covers power, natural gas, and/or environmental trading activities including new business initiatives and ongoing continuous process improvements. This is an exceptional opportunity to contribute to a world\\-class organization and make a significant impact in supporting our business.


**You will contribute to our team by**

* Supporting month\\-end general ledger close processes and reporting through analysis of results, account reconciliations, daily reconciliation and check\\-out process for trading transactions, preparation of entries including accruals, and timely counterparty invoicing, collection and payment activities.
* Applying continuously expanding industry and accounting skills and knowledge to support the growing trading activities across North America’s power, natural gas, and renewables sectors.
* Coordinating and aligning transaction details and other data between 3rd party counterparties and ISOs, and internal business partners including but not limited to Finance, Trading and Origination, Information Services, Legal, and Risk Management groups.
* Becoming proficient working with the energy trading and risk management system (ETRM), EPM system and various other applications to execute daily and monthly activities.
* Supporting new business and systems initiatives including identification, recommendations, planning, and execution of continuous process improvement projects positively impacting the effectiveness of controls, and efficiency and effectiveness of processes.
* Establishing and maintaining a strong working rapport with both internal and external parties, including accurately responding to inquiries in a timely and professional manner.
* Assisting with deliverables associated with quarter\\-end interim reviews and year\\-end audits.
* Maintaining updated documentation and checklists around the accounting processes, ensuring adherence to CSOX and other internal controls.
* Adhering to HSE procedures/rules and standards.

**What you will bring to the role**

**Education**

* Degree/diploma in accounting, business or related field.
* Progression toward a CPA or CFA designation is an asset.

**Experience:**

* 3 \\-5 years of demonstrated accounting experience with preference given to those with energy trading finance or risk management, or equivalent experience.
* Previous experience with trade accounting applications such as Allegro or TriplePoint, and EPM applications such as Oracle or SAP is considered an asset.
* The ideal candidate will be experienced in accounting/settlements, competent in developing Excel models and tools required to reconcile large amounts of data between disparate sources and understand the wholesale electricity markets and charges.

**Technical Skills**

* Proficiency with MS Office suite of applications, Excel in particular.
* High attention to detail, analytical and strong problem\\-solving skills.
* Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal), including the ability to work effectively with others and cultivate strong relationships across functional teams.
* Excellent time management and organizational skills. Preference will be given to those with demonstrated project and/or change management skills to keep pace with our growing business.

**Working Conditions:**

* Hybrid Office/Work from home position, with possible travel to meet business users at Capital Power facilities or other offices.
* Overtime hours required during peak periods including weekends based on timing of deadlines.

**Additional Details**

This position will remain open until a suitable candidate is found.


To be considered for this role you must be legally eligible to work in Canada.


The successful candidate for this position will undergo an education verification, reference checks and criminal record check.  



Capital Power employees that refer a successful candidate for this position are eligible for a **$1000** Referral Reward!


We believe that creating a culture that supports employee physical, mental, financial, and social wellbeing is critical to our success. That is why we provide flexible and affordable employee benefits, retirement savings, and paid time off programs. We also provide comprehensive onboarding, training, and programs supporting your career development.


**How To Apply and Next Steps**

Capital Power only accepts resumes via online application at www.capitalpower.com/careers . If you choose to submit your resume by any other means, we cannot guarantee that your application will be considered for vacancies.
  

  

Applicants with disabilities who require a reasonable accommodation to complete their application can request accessible formats, communication support, or other accessibility assistance by contacting careers@capitalpower.com .
  

  

Capital Power is committed to providing a fair and transparent hiring process. We recognize and embrace the value of diversity and hire employees with the appropriate skills, experience and knowledge for each position.
  

  

Thank you for taking the time to apply and expressing interest in powering a sustainable future with Capital Power! We wish that we could personally respond to everyone who applies; however, it is our practice to contact only those individuals selected for interviews.

title: Commodity Marketing Contract Analyst
description:
Date last modified: January 6, 2026

**Job Title: Commodity Marketing Contract Analyst**
===================================================


Reporting to: Senior Manager, Crude Oil Trading and Marketing

**Key Areas of Accountability and Responsibility**
--------------------------------------------------

  

APMC plays a key role in maximizing value for Albertans by marketing the Province’s crude oil royalty barrels and supporting strategic energy initiatives. We are a collaborative, high‑performing team committed to innovation, integrity, and delivering value for the Crown.


We are seeking a Commodity Marketing Contract Analyst to support the administration and execution of Commodity Marketing Contracts. This role is ideal for someone who thrives in a fast‑paced environment, takes ownership of their work, and enjoys working closely with traders, schedulers, and external counterparties.


The following are key responsibilities:

* Ensure timely and accurate execution of commodity marketing contracts in compliance with Delegation of Authority, minimizing operational and financial risk.
* Review, validate, and accurately capture contractual details in internal contract management and settlement systems.
* Work with crude oil traders and schedulers to resolve discrepancies and ensure contracts are returned and filed according to policy.
* Communicate professionally and effectively with internal and external stakeholders through written, electronic, and in\\-person interactions.
* Support the crude oil marketing team by managing routine administrative tasks.
* Play an active role in the ETRM system project, contributing contract‑management expertise to system selection, testing, and implementation activities.
* Collaborate with team members to identify process improvement opportunities and assist with updating procedures and policy documentation.
* Maintain strict confidentiality of sensitive business information.
* Provide backup support during peak workload periods or staff absences.

**Candidate Attributes, Professional Experience and Qualifications**
--------------------------------------------------------------------

* Minimum 3 years of commercial contract analysis or related experience in the Oil \\& Gas sector.
* Undergraduate degree or diploma in Business Administration or a related discipline.
* Proven ability to perform effectively in a fast\\-paced environment with multiple competing deadlines.
* Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.
* Knowledge across commercial functions such as deal capture, contracts, scheduling, risk, invoicing, and accounting is highly valued.
* Exposure to other energy segments (natural gas, NGLs, petrochemicals, FX, tax, legal) is considered an asset.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills with effective interpersonal abilities.
* Self‑motivated, detail‑oriented, and able to work independently or collaboratively within a team environment.
company_description: APMC operates as the Crown's agent in marketing its royalty share of resource production in Alberta's petroleum sector.

title: Intern - Intelligence - 264
description:
**Why YOU Want This Position**

Enverus is the leading energy SaaS company delivering highly technical insights and predictive/prescriptive analytics that empower customers to make the right decisions. Enverus’ innovative technologies drive production and investment strategies, enable best practices for energy and commodity trading and risk management, and reduce costs through automated processes across critical business functions. Enverus is a strategic partner to more than 6,000 customers in 50 countries.

We are seeking two highly motivated individuals to serve as **Interns** on our Enverus Intelligence Research team (EIR) between Macro Fundamentals and Power Assets. You will collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of engineers, financial analysts, and geologists to ensure data integrity, analyze trends and publish actionable investment research for investment banks, private equity, hedge funds, institutional investors as well as energy companies. The ideal candidate demonstrates strong analytical and communication skills and excels in a fast paced, dynamic environment.

This full\\-time role is based out of our Calgary office. We look forward to welcoming the successful candidate for a **12\\-month term beginning in September 2026**.  

**Performance Objectives*** Aggregate, clean and analyze large data sets to identify trends, characterize opportunities, value assets and analyze market activity using internal workflows built in Enverus Prism™.
* Update, maintain and improve proprietary databases critical for formulating opinions on assets including well production data, renewable projects and financial data.
* Participate in conference calls with clients and prospects, leveraging or demonstrating Enverus Intelligence™ and Enverus Core™ solutions to help answer some of the most challenging questions facing the energy industry and energy investors today.
* Maintain financial and forecasting models using SEC filings, investor documents, transcripts, press releases, and government and industry datasets.

**Competitive Candidate Profile*** Pursuing an undergraduate degree in Engineering, Finance, Accounting, Mathematics, or a related field
* Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, with a specific focus on Excel
* Familiarity with using programming concepts to manage and analyze large, complex datasets.
* Excellent interpersonal, organizational and communication skills, strong attention to detail, self\\-motivated with a strong work ethic
* A demonstrated passion for the energy sector

title: SDR (Germany, Spain or France)
description:
**Location:** **Germany, Spain, France**


**Position Type: Full\\-time, Permanent**


**Work model: Remote**


**Industry: Commodities \\& Energy**

 **About us:**



Founded in 1995, Zema Global Data Corporation empowers organizations to simplify complexity, reduce risk, and make faster, more confident decisions that drive measurable results. Over the past two years, Zema Global has accelerated its growth through strategic investment and acquisition to strengthen our global leadership. Together we’re helping our customers gain a Decisioning Advantage – one bold idea at a time. With a presence across global energy, commodity, and financial markets, Zema Global empowers customers to simplify complexity, reduce risk, and make faster, more confident decisions that drive measurable results.

  

At Zema Global, we Think Big, Make It Happen, and Win as One. We thrive on collaboration, creativity, and respect, united by a shared drive to innovate and deliver meaningful impact for our customers and communities. If you’re inspired by solving complex challenges and contributing to a culture that values purpose and performance, we invite you to join us.

 **Position overview:**



At Zema Global, we help energy and commodities organizations turn complex data into confident decisions. As a Sales Development Representative (SDR), you will play a critical role in connecting prospective customers with our data management and analytics solutions, helping to shape the very first stages of the customer journey.

  

This role is ideal for someone who is commercially curious, motivated by impact, and eager to build a career in B2B technology sales. You will work at the intersection of marketing, sales, and market intelligence \\- engaging senior stakeholders, uncovering meaningful business challenges, and generating high\\-quality opportunities for our sales team.

 **Key responsibilities:**


**Build pipeline \\& engage prospects**


* Generate qualified revenue pipeline by setting introductory meetings with target influencers and decision\\-makers across energy and commodities markets.
* Proactively identify and engage new and existing accounts through a combination of outbound calling, personalized email, and social outreach.
* Qualify inbound and outbound leads by understanding customer needs, priorities, and alignment with Zema Global’s solutions.

  


**Understand the market \\& customer challenges**


* Research prospect organizations, industry trends, and use cases to deliver relevant and thoughtful outreach.
* Develop a strong understanding of Zema Global’s products, data capabilities, and the challenges faced by energy and commodities businesses.
* Capture insights from prospect conversations and share feedback with Sales and Marketing to refine messaging and targeting.

  


**Collaborate \\& Execute**


* Partner closely with Sales Executives to ensure a seamless handover of qualified opportunities.
* Work with Marketing on campaigns, follow\\-up strategies, and lead engagement across the funnel.
* Collaborate with cross\\-functional teams, contributing to a culture of continuous learning and shared success.
* Operate with Discipline \\& Curiosity
* Maintain accurate and up\\-to\\-date records in CRM and sales engagement tools.
* Manage time and priorities effectively in a fast\\-paced, high\\-growth environment.
* Test new approaches, learn from outcomes, and share best practices with the wider SDR and sales team.

  


**What we’re looking for:**


* Experience in B2B SaaS sales development, business development, or a similar customer\\-facing commercial role, with exposure to mid\\-market and enterprise organizations.
* Hands\\-on experience using HubSpot as a primary CRM is essential, including managing leads, activities, pipeline reporting, and data quality; experience with additional sales tools is a plus.
* Industry knowledge of the energy and commodities markets, with an understanding of data management, analytics, and/or ETRM solutions, and how these support commercial, trading, and operational teams.
* Confidence engaging and communicating with senior stakeholders across commercial, technology, and operations functions in a clear, credible, and consultative manner.
* A strong ability to assess prospect needs, personalize outreach, and identify high\\-quality opportunities aligned to complex and data\\-driven business challenges.
* Experience planning and executing structured outbound and inbound prospecting activity, with a focus on consistency, quality, and measurable pipeline impact.
* Curiosity about market dynamics, regulatory change, and evolving customer needs within energy and commodities, using this insight to improve engagement and messaging.
* Familiarity with sales engagement and data tools such as Apollo, LinkedIn Navigator, Salesforce, or similar platforms (experience working with analytics\\- or data\\-led SaaS products is a plus).
* A proactive and adaptable mindset, comfortable operating in a fast\\-paced, high\\-growth environment and continuously testing new approaches to improve results.
* A collaborative and coachable attitude, with a strong desire to develop your sales skills and grow your impact at Zema Global.

  


**Desirable:**


* Bachelor’s degree in business, Marketing, or related field.
* Language skills (Spanish / German / French)

  


**Our benefits (UK):**


* Competitive Salary
* Private Medical Insurance (Health \\& Dental)
* Life Insurance
* Group Income Protection
* Eligible for discretionary performance\\-based bonus
* Hybrid Working
* 25 Days Annual Leave \\+ Public Holidays.
* Professional Development \\& Learning Opportunities
* Fun Culture \\& Regular Socials

  


**How to Apply:**



Please send your CV highlighting your relevant experience (we only accept CVs in English). Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. No agency submissions, please.

 **\\*\\*\\* No visa sponsorship is available for this position \\*\\*\\***


**Equality and Diversity:** Zema Global is committed to diversity and inclusion. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals and do not discriminate based on race, gender, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected status.

title: Adjoint au Chief Technology Risk Manager (F/H)
description:
**Notre activité**
------------------


Envie d'embarquer pour une nouvelle aventure professionnelle ? Rejoignez BPCE Vie !


Qui sommes\\-nous ?


BPCE Vie est une compagnie du pôle Assurances du Groupe BPCE. Coopératif, banquier et assureur, notre groupe est au service de 35 millions de clients.


Nous concevons des solutions d’assurances de personnes (assurance vie, épargne, retraite, prévoyance individuelle, assurance des emprunteurs) pour les clients des réseaux bancaires du Groupe BPCE (Banques Populaires et Caisses d’Epargne). Nous sommes 900 collaborateurs basés à Lille, Rennes, Reims et Paris, prêts à vous accueillir.

  



**Vos missions au sein de l'équipe**
------------------------------------

* Établir et appliquer la gouvernance des risques TIC : mettre en œuvre les politiques de gestion des risques TIC définies par le groupe, en les adaptant aux spécificités de chaque entité tout en garantissant leur cohérence avec les directives globales.


* Identifier et surveiller les risques TIC : analyser en profondeur les risques liés aux systèmes, applications et infrastructures technologiques, en tenant compte des vulnérabilités, des menaces et des Business Impacts associés.


* Évaluer la criticité des actifs technologiques : collaborer avec la première ligne de défense pour classer les actifs technologiques selon leur criticité et l'impact potentiel sur les opérations en cas de défaillance ou d'incident.


* Assurer une supervision indépendante des contrôles: évaluer objectivement les pratiques de gestion des risques mises en œuvre par la première ligne de défense, en questionnant la robustesse et l'efficacité de ces contrôles.


* Suivre les évolutions réglementaires spécifiques aux technologies : identifier et évaluer les impacts des nouvelles réglementations ou standards de l'industrie sur la gestion des risques TIC.


* Assurer la conformité aux normes de sécurité technologique : vérifier que toutes les pratiques respectent les lois, normes et directives en matière de sécurité des systèmes d'information.


* Communiquer sur les risques TIC : rendre compte de manière détaillée des risques identifiés aux instances dirigeantes, tout en maintenant une indépendance vis\\-à\\-vis des décisions opérationnelles.


* Promouvoir une culture de gestion des risques TIC : encourager une approche proactive sur les risques TIC à tous les niveaux de l'organisation, en sensibilisant les collaborateurs à l'importance de la sécurité et de la gestion des risques.


Plan de Continuité d'Activité (PCA)


En tant que suppléant du Responsable Plan Continuité d’Activité (RPCA), l'A\\-CTRM devra maîtriser les processus de l'entreprise relatifs au PCA. Cela inclut la réalisation et l'analyse des Business Impact Analyses (BIA) pour identifier les impacts potentiels des interruptions d'activité, ainsi que la mise en œuvre et la validation des plans de continuité d'activité (PCA) et de reprise d'activité (PRA). L'A\\-CTRM jouera un rôle clé dans la préparation et la conduite des exercices de simulation, garantissant ainsi la résilience de l'organisation face aux incidents majeurs.


* Application des normes et réglementations : assurer la conformité de l'organisation avec les normes ISO 22301 et ISO 27001, garantissant ainsi une approche structurée et reconnue pour la continuité d'activité et la sécurité de l'information.


* Réalisation d'analyses d'impact sur les activités (BIA) : mener des analyses d'impact approfondies pour identifier les processus critiques de l'organisation et évaluer leur tolérance à l'indisponibilité, contribuant ainsi à une meilleure préparation face aux interruptions.


* Création et gestion de PCA/PRA : élaborer, mettre à jour et gérer le plan de continuité d'activité (PCA) et des plans de reprise d'activité (PRA) qui répondent efficacement aux besoins spécifiques de l'organisation, assurant ainsi la résilience opérationnelle.


* Conception et mise en œuvre d'exercices de simulation : concevoir et réaliser des exercices de simulation pour tester l'efficacité des PCA et PRA


* Gestion proactive des incidents


* Formation et sensibilisation des collaborateurs

**Vos atouts pour réussir**
---------------------------


Nous recherchons un candidat possédant les compétences et l'expérience suivantes :\\*

  

  

* Expérience : 3 à 5 ans dans la gestion des risques TIC et la sécurité de l'information.
* Connaissances Techniques : maîtrise des concepts de gouvernance IT et d'aspects techniques relatifs à la sécurité de l'information, incluant la classification des données, la protection des données, la cybersécurité, la gestion des accès, le SIEM (Security Information and Event Management) et la gestion des incidents.
* Gestion de Projets : expérience avérée dans la gestion de projets d'externalisation, avec une compréhension des implications sur la sécurité des systèmes d'information.
* Assurances de Personnes : connaissance des activités d'assurances de personnes
* Compétences en Gestion de Projet : familiarité avec la gestion de projet informatique, l'architecture IT et les infrastructures IT.
* Approche Proactive : sens de l'appropriation et des responsabilités, capacité à remettre en question le statu quo et à promouvoir une approche des contrôles axée sur les risques.
* Compétences Interpersonnelles : créativité, initiative et orientation vers les résultats, avec d'excellentes compétences en communication et une aisance à interagir avec les parties prenantes.
* Outils et Technologies : connaissance des outils du groupe, notamment DRIVE.


Ce profil est essentiel pour contribuer à la sécurité et à la gestion des risques TIC au sein de notre organisation tout en soutenant la mise en œuvre des politiques définies par le groupe.**Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?**
-----------------------------


De réelles opportunités de carrière et de développement


* Une politique de mobilité dynamique : 1 poste sur 2 est pourvu par nos talents internes.


* Des programmes de développement pour booster la carrière de nos collaborateurs.


* Un fort investissement dans la formation continue : 1,7 million d’euros consacrés au développement des compétences soit plus de 2,5 jours de formation par an par collaborateur.


* Un accompagnement personnalisé et de proximité par l’équipe RH et le management pour vous permettre de vous réaliser et de vous épanouir au sein du Groupe BPCE.


Et aussi, de nombreux avantages …


* Intéressement et participation : une rémunération complémentaire pouvant représenter jusqu’à 2 à 3 mois du salaire brut.


* Épargne salariale : jusqu’à 3 700 € d’abondement annuel.


* Flexibilité : jusqu’à 28 jours de congés payés, entre 17 et 24 jours de RTT et jusqu’à 10 jours de télétravail par mois.


* Santé : une mutuelle performante et prise en charge à 60% par l’employeur.


* Transports : prise en charge jusqu'à 75 % de vos frais.


* Avantages familiaux : participation aux frais de garde et complément familial.


* Avantages CSE : de nombreuses prestations et réductions sont proposées (sport, voyages, culture…)


Un collectif motivé et engagé (source : Great Place to Work 2024\\)


* 88 % de nos collaborateurs déclarent que BPCE VIE est une entreprise où il fait vraiment bon travailler.


* \\+ de 92 % de nos collaborateurs se disent être traités équitablement quel que soit leur genre, leurs orientations sexuelles et leur origine ethnique


* Nos collaborateurs peuvent coopter et recevoir jusqu’à 2000 € par recrutement.


Un environnement de travail stimulant et serein


* Bien être : certifiée Great Place To Work®, BPCE Vie figure au palmarès Best Workplaces™ qui distingue les cent meilleures entreprises reconnues pour leur haut niveau de qualité de vie au travail en France


* Un parcours d’intégration convivial : Vous intégrez une « promo » et vivez une intégration sur plusieurs mois, en proximité de nos métiers sur nos différents sites ! 96 % des salariés plébiscitent la qualité du parcours (source : GPTW 2024\\).


Une stratégie ambitieuse


* Ambition : nous voulons, d’ici 2030, devenir le quatrième assureur en France.


Nous en sommes sûrs : vous avez beaucoup à nous apporter et nous allons marquer votre vie ! Rejoignez\\-nous !
company_description: Le Groupe BPCE exerce tous les métiers de la banque et de l’assurance en s’appuyant sur ses deux grands réseaux coopératifs.

title: Consultant Débutant Commodities - Septembre 2026 F/H
description:
*C**hez EY, nous sommes « All in » pour façonner votre avenir en toute confiance.* *Ensemble, nous orienterons votre carrière selon vos aspirations. Rejoignez EY et contribuez à construire un monde meilleur.*

Nous recrutons des **Consultantes et consultants Débutant(e)s Commodities** en CDI,
A compter de **septembre 2026** pour le bureau de Paris
**Notre Opportunité :**

Au sein du département GFS (Global Financial Services), 1 400 collaborateurs en France combinent leurs expertises métiers et fonctionnelles, afin de répondre efficacement aux besoins de nos clients. Dans un contexte en perpétuel changement et hautement réglementé, nous apportons ainsi à nos clients des conseils pour les aider à gérer les incertitudes et les opportunités de ce secteur.


Composée de 160 collaborateurs, notre équipe est spécialisée dans le conseil en transformation de la fonction Finance. Nous accompagnons les Directions Financières et opérationnelles de nos clients dans leurs réflexions sur le dispositif de gestion du risque de matières premières et propose des outils innovants de pilotage des activités de «hedging » ou de commodity trading.




**Vos principales responsabilités :**

Basé à Paris, vous interviendrez en tant que consultant/e junior, chez nos clients et/ou dans nos locaux, sur des missions de conseil et d’audit financier pour les sociétés de divers secteurs (énergie, agri/agro, métaux …) dont la performance est sensible à l’évolution du cours de matières premières. Nos missions adressent les enjeux suivants :

* Gestion du risque de matières premières : assistance à la définition d’un cadre de gestion, réalisation de cartographies des risques, analyse des expositions et simulation d’impact de la volatilité des cours, définition d’indicateurs de risques, mise en place de systèmes de surveillance des activités de trading
* Organisation des activités de « hedging » ou de trading de matières premières : définition de l’organisation cible, conception des processus opérationnels, robotisation, accompagnement dans le cadre de l’implémentation d’un CTRM
* Conception des outils de pilotage des activités de mise aux marchés




**Ce que nous recherchons:**

* Vous êtes diplômé(e) d'une formation Bac\\+5, vous avez de préférence une première expérience acquise au sein d’un cabinet de conseil, d’une direction financière ou des risques ou d’une salle de marchés durant laquelle vous avez été confronté aux risques liés aux matières premières.
* Vous souhaitez développer des compétences sur des sujets financiers liés aux commodities et à la gestion des risques.
* Doté(e) d'un excellent sens relationnel, vous savez allier le sens de l'analyse et de la synthèse, rigueur et méthode.
* Vous êtes curieux(se), dynamique, responsable et autonome, vous faites preuve d'esprit d'équipe
* Une bonne maîtrise de l'anglais est indispensable.
* Une connaissance sur des sujets comptables (IFRS 9, ANC 2015\\-05…) serait un plus.




**Ce que nous vous offrons :**

* Le développement de vos compétences et des expériences uniques au sein d’un environnement de travail diversifié et inclusif.
* Un environnement de travail flexible \\#Smartworking@EY
* L’opportunité de découvrir d’autres cultures en travaillant au contact d’équipes connectées à l’échelle mondiale et grâce à notre programme de mobilité à l’international \\#Mobility4U.
* Un package complet : un bonus discrétionnaire annuel, une prime de participation, des RTT, une mutuelle avantageuse, une carte titre\\-restaurant, le remboursement de votre abonnement de transports en commun à hauteur de 75% ou une aide financière pour l’achat d’un vélo.
* De nombreux autres avantages : des primes de cooptation, un abonnement sportif Wellpass à tarif préférentiel, l’entrée gratuite aux musées du Louvre et Eugène\\-Delacroix, un accès privilégié à l’Opéra de Paris..

**Etes\\-vous prêt à façonner votre avenir avec confiance ? Postulez dès aujourd'hui.**


Le processus de recrutement est composé de 3 étapes ; des tests à réaliser en ligne, une session de recrutement durant laquelle vous rencontrerez nos managers et un dernier entretien avec l’une ou l’un de nos Associé(e)s.


Les entretiens, menés à distance et en présentiel, permettent d’échanger sur votre parcours, d’évaluer vos compétences et de répondre à vos questions.




**Dans le cadre de sa politique Inclusion, EY étudie, à compétences égales, toutes candidatures dont celles de personnes en situation de handicap.**




*EY s'engage à créer de la valeur pour ses clients, ses collaborateurs et collaboratrices, la société et la planète, tout en renforçant la confiance dans les marchés financiers. Grâce à la data, à l'intelligence artificielle et aux technologies avancées, les équipes aident les clients à façonner l'avenir avec confiance et à développer des solutions pour les enjeux d’aujourd'hui et de demain. Les équipes EY interviennent dans l’audit, le conseil, la fiscalité, la stratégie et les transactions. Fortes d'une expertise sectorielle, d'un réseau multidisciplinaire connecté à l'échelle mondiale et de partenaires d'écosystème diversifiés, les équipes EY interviennent dans plus de 150 pays et territoires.*
