title: Platform Lead - Trading
description:
**Why explore**

* An opportunity to drive improvements
* Exposure to global operations, processes and stakeholders
* Work in a collaborative and fast paced environment
* Based in Singapore, a global commercial hub for Rio Tinto

**About the role**


We are seeking a highly skilled and proactive **Platform Lead** to join our Digital Division. In this pivotal role, you will lead platform support team, coaching analysts/developers, and ensuring smooth integration with business\\-as\\-usual operations.


Reporting to the Platform Manager, you will:

* Oversee product/platform governance, ensuring applications meet scalability, security, and business objectives.
* Guide platform analysts and developers to deliver reliable, high\\-value digital solutions.
* Maintain technical integrity and performance through standards and best practices.
* Manage operational risks and ensure timely resolution of platform\\-related issues.
* Align resource allocation and budgeting with delivery objectives
* Ensure compliance with governance frameworks and vendor management.
* Support career development and knowledge\\-sharing initiatives.
* Provide strategic direction for platform management aligned with digital division goals.
* Drive initiatives that enhance platform capabilities and support organizational objectives.
* Promote collaboration among business stakeholders, analysts, developers, and project teams to deliver seamless project implementation and business continuity.

**Domain Knowledge Required:**

* Deep understanding in derivative trading, physical commodity trading including MtM and accounting posting.
* Experienced in various integration pattern between CTRM to ERP and/or other digital platforms.
* Familiarity with CTRM/ETRM systems; Fusion by Fendahl is preferred.
* Knowledge of ZE by ZEMA is preferred.

**About you**

**To be successfully considered for this role, you will have:**

* Relevant degree qualifications.
* 10\\+ years in application development and delivery, including 5–7 years in managerial roles.
* Proven leadership and stakeholder management experience, guiding system/platform teams.
* Solid knowledge of SDLC, data governance, release management, and IT risk/compliance.
* Strong understanding of project management, change control, risk management, and awareness of emerging technology trends.
* Experience with platform governance, operational risk management, and vendor management.

**What we offer**

* A work environment where safety is always the number one priority
* A competitive salary package with annual cash incentive awards for eligible employees
* Career development \\& education assistance to further your ambitions
* Access top tier family\\-friendly health and medical programs and pension plan
* Wellbeing benefits
* Generous Rio Tinto employee share program
* Employee Assistance Program
* Ongoing individual wellbeing support for you and your family for personal and professional matter
* Leave for all of life’s reasons (vacation/annual, paid parental, sick leave)

**Where you will be working**


Our Commercial function at Rio Tinto connects our product groups, customers and suppliers from mine to market. We bring together Sales \\& Marketing and Trading (Sell), Global Procurement (Buy), and Marine \\& Logistics (Move) to buy, sell and move the materials the world needs, by partnering across the value chain to optimise outcomes for our customers and the Group. Headquartered in our global Commercial hub in Singapore, and with a strong presence in Chicago, Frankfurt, Antwerp and across Asia in Beijing, Shanghai, Tokyo and Seoul, we work as one team to deliver customer centric value, safely and sustainably.


Work at the heart of our global Commercial hub in Singapore, partnering cross‑functionally across Buy, Sell and Move to shape strategy and deliver mine‑to‑market value around the world.

**Application Deadline: 13 February 2025** *(Rio Tinto reserves the right to remove job postings prior to the stated closing date)*

*Please note, in order to be successfully considered for this role you must complete all pre\\-screening questions.*

*Rio Tinto does not accept unsolicited CVs or candidate profiles from recruiters or employment agencies. Rio Tinto will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee relating to unsolicited CVs or candidate profiles. Rio Tinto reserves the right to hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited CVs or candidate profiles, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Rio Tinto.”*

**About Rio Tinto**

  

Rio Tinto is a leading global mining and materials company. We operate in 35 countries where we produce iron ore, copper, aluminium, critical minerals, and other materials needed for the global energy transition and for people, communities, and nations to thrive.

  

We have been mining for 150 years and operate with knowledge built up across generations and continents. Our purpose is finding better ways to provide the materials the world needs – striving for innovation and continuous improvement to produce materials with low emissions and to the right environmental, social and governance standards. title: System Support Analyst
description:
Enterprise System Support Analyst role sits between trading/business users, IT, and vendors, ensuring the company business critical systems (e.g. ETRM) run reliably and supports day\\-to\\-day energy trading operations.

**Core Responsibilities:**

* Monitor system health and batch jobs across ETRM, ERP, and other enterprise applications.
* Handle production incident tickets (trades not booking, valuations wrong, reports failing)
* Support front\\-office, middle\\-office, back\\-office users
* Perform trade corrections and reprocessing
* Support end\\-of\\-day (EOD) and month\\-end closing
* Validate market data (prices, curves, indices)
* Basic SQL queries to investigate data issues.
* Monitor ETRM batch jobs and interfaces to peripheral systems (MarketView, ICE, SAP and other in\\-house systems). Attend to job failures and error logs, perform triage and manual re\\-run/correction.
* Log and maintain daily incident tickets. Timely attend to reported issues and user enquiries. Gather issue details, error messages, system logs, replication steps for further investigation.
* Help to manage vendor's SLA metrics.
* Create/update static data and user account access setup based on approved business requests.﻿

**﻿Job Requirements:**

* **﻿﻿**Diploma/Degree in Computer Science or Information Technology
* ﻿﻿At least 3 years of business systems support experience.
* Worked in commodity trading industry or hands\\-on experience on ETRM systems will be an added advantage.
* Hands\\-on experience on application infrastructure support. Understanding of cloud servers and services, able to perform diagnosis and escalations on system outage.
* Basic SQL and troubleshooting skills, able to analyze application logs and perform simple debugging.
* Knowledge of ITIL processes and ticketing tools (ServiceNow, Jira, DevOps)
* Ability to communicate clearly with business users
* Calm and structured approach under time pressure.
* Bilingual in both English and Chinese will be an added advantage.

Job Type: Full\\-time

Pay: $6,000\\.00 \\- $8,000\\.00 per month

Work Location: In person

title: Senior Advisor Business Analyst
description:
**Why explore**

* An opportunity to drive improvements
* Exposure to global operations, processes and stakeholders
* Work in a collaborative and fast paced environment
* Based in Singapore, a global commercial hub for Rio Tinto

**About the role**


We are seeking a **Senior Advisor Business Analyst** who will plays a pivotal role in analyzing complex business scenarios, defining requirements, and enabling the delivery of digital solutions across the Rio Tinto Commercial. This role serves as a digital business partner, bridging technologists and business stakeholders. It identifies pain points through the business user’s lens and translate business requirements into technical specifications and work closely with software developers/engineering team to implement solutions.


Reporting to the Digital Manager, you will:

* Lead the full requirements lifecycle, delivering clear, actionable user stories and specifications.
* Engage cross‑functional stakeholders through expert consultancy and structured facilitation.
* Support change readiness, training, and adoption for new systems and processes.
* Analyse end‑to‑end business processes to identify gaps, inefficiencies, and improvement opportunities.
* Partner with business stakeholders, digital/delivery managers, data analysts/scientists and platform/engineering teams to ensure alignment and clarity throughout delivery.
* Possess deep knowledge of end‑to‑end system and data flows, reporting needs, and integration requirements to guide analytics and system enhancements.
* Serve as the data subject‑matter expert and owner of the business data glossary, ensuring consistency, quality, and alignment within the assigned domain.
* Identify and champion innovation opportunities that elevate business efficiency and user experience.

**About you**

**To be successfully considered for this role, you will have:**

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, Data Analytics, or any related discipline is preferred.
* At least 5 years of experience as a Business Analyst/Product Owner in translating business requirements into actionable digital deliverables.
* Hands\\-on experience with SQL and/or data analysis/ETL tool (Python, Snowflake, Power BI, Databricks, etc) to analyse and interpret complex data sets to provide insights.
* Proven track record in delivering digital products/solutions using Scrum/SDLC Methodology. Certified Product Owner or Scrum Master is preferred.
* Experience in creating test plans, test scenarios, and test cases to support system changes and project delivery.
* Strong analytical, communication and facilitation skills across diverse stakeholder groups.
* Experience in commodity trading/supply value chain, CTRM, ERP or data‑driven environments preferred.
* Having human centred design or design thinking experience will be a plus.

**What we offer**

* A work environment where safety is always the number one priority
* A competitive salary package with annual cash incentive awards for eligible employees
* Career development \\& education assistance to further your ambitions
* Access top tier family\\-friendly health and medical programs and pension plan
* Wellbeing benefits
* Generous Rio Tinto employee share program
* Employee Assistance Program
* Ongoing individual wellbeing support for you and your family for personal and professional matter
* Leave for all of life’s reasons (vacation/annual, paid parental, sick leave)

**Where you will be working**


Our Commercial function at Rio Tinto connects our product groups, customers and suppliers from mine to market. We bring together Sales \\& Marketing and Trading (Sell), Global Procurement (Buy), and Marine \\& Logistics (Move) to buy, sell and move the materials the world needs, by partnering across the value chain to optimise outcomes for our customers and the Group. Headquartered in our global Commercial hub in Singapore, and with a strong presence in Chicago, Frankfurt, Antwerp and across Asia in Beijing, Shanghai, Tokyo and Seoul, we work as one team to deliver customer centric value, safely and sustainably.


Work at the heart of our global Commercial hub in Singapore, partnering cross‑functionally across Buy, Sell and Move to shape strategy and deliver mine‑to‑market value around the world.

**Application Deadline: 20 February 2026** *(Rio Tinto reserves the right to remove job postings prior to the stated closing date)*

*Please note, in order to be successfully considered for this role you must complete all pre\\-screening questions.*

*Rio Tinto does not accept unsolicited CVs or candidate profiles from recruiters or employment agencies. Rio Tinto will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee relating to unsolicited CVs or candidate profiles. Rio Tinto reserves the right to hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited CVs or candidate profiles, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Rio Tinto.”*

**About Rio Tinto**

  

Rio Tinto is a leading global mining and materials company. We operate in 35 countries where we produce iron ore, copper, aluminium, critical minerals, and other materials needed for the global energy transition and for people, communities, and nations to thrive.

  

We have been mining for 150 years and operate with knowledge built up across generations and continents. Our purpose is finding better ways to provide the materials the world needs – striving for innovation and continuous improvement to produce materials with low emissions and to the right environmental, social and governance standards. But we can’t do it on our own, so we’re focused on creating partnerships to solve problems, create win\\-win situations and meet opportunities.

**Respect and Inclusion**  

  

At Rio Tinto, we particularly welcome and encourage applications from Indigenous Peoples, women, the LGBTQIA\\+ community, mature workers, people with disabilities and people from different cultural backgrounds.  

  

We are committed to an inclusive environment where people feel comfortable to be themselves. We want our people to feel that all voices are heard, all cultures respected and that a variety of perspectives are not only welcome – they are essential to our success. We treat each other fairly and with dignity regardless of race, gender, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual orientation or anything else that makes us different.

title: Market Risk Analyst
description:
Job Description
JOB SUMMARY:* Work in the Market Risk department as a Market Risk Analyst, an integral member of the team that provides independent oversight over market risks across the Downstream Trading business.
* Assist in innovation and automation projects; drive process enhancement deliverables.
* We are seeking an individual with strong technical skills and a good commercial understanding to carry out day\\-to\\-day analysis, reporting and commentary of risk factors and drivers impacting the business. The Analyst will also work closely with the Functional teams to provide risk and control assurance of the policies and procedures. The Analyst will be actively involved in the development of new business intelligence and visual analytics tools to enable data\\-driven insights as part of a firm\\-wide transformation programme.


YOU GET TO:* Manage and maintain daily market risk measurement activities of the Downstream Trading business with commodities trading risk management systems (CTRM).
* Review risk reports with analysis and attribution of market risk exposures on trading strategies, positions and intent. Work with Front office teams to develop a strong understanding of the business.
* Monitor daily market risk measures against limits; communication/escalation of high limit utilization and breaches for timely ratification/rectification.
* Validate and backtest market risk calculations to ensure conformity to accepted risk model requirements.
* Work in close partnership with Functional teams to ensure compliance with risk and control policies and procedures.
* Review new business/product, including any new, addition, or change around products and/or business activities.
* Contribute to design, development and implementation of CTRM, business intelligence and visual analytics tools.


REQUIREMENTS* Degree in Finance, Economics, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Computing or any other equivalent disciplines
* Some internship/work experience in commodities risk management, finance, trading or marketing; Fresh graduates are welcome to apply
* Excellent problem solving skills
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills
* Able to establish and maintain effective and cooperative work relationships both within and outside the department
* Ability to work well as part of a team
* Microsoft Excel
* Strong interest in moving into a market risk/middle office role


Required Qualification(s)
Responsibilities and Skills
Education
Language(s)

title: Responsable Approvisionnement et Trading H/F 80-100%
description:
Actif·ve·s en Suisse occidentale, nous aidons nos client·e·s à réaliser leurs projets en fournissant des solutions énergétiques globales, efficaces et durables, qu’il s’agisse de production et de distribution d’électricité et de chaleur, d’installations électriques, de domotique, de mobilité douce, de climatisation ou de traitement de l’eau. Employeur exemplaire, nous soutenons le développement des compétences de nos 2450 collaborateurs·trice·s, dont 245 apprenti·e·s, ainsi que la conciliation entre vie privée et professionnelle.

  


**La Direction Energie électrique** exploite les infrastructures de production hydrauliques et thermiques, développe des installations de production à partir d’énergies renouvelables et assure un approvisionnement en électricité aux meilleures conditions.

  


**Mission :**

* Définir, proposer et piloter la stratégie d’approvisionnement énergétique à court, moyen et long terme, en garantissant la sécurité d’approvisionnement, la cohérence entre prévisions et besoins, ainsi que le suivi des performances et des résultats financiers
* Planifier, coordonner et superviser les activités de gestion court et long terme, gérer les portefeuilles d’approvisionnement, de consommation et de production, anticiper et maîtriser les risques liés aux marchés de l’énergie, en collaboration étroite avec le Risk Manager et le Comité des Risques Énergie
* Optimiser la valorisation de l’énergie issue des moyens de production (en propre et en participation), analyser les projets de prise de participation, assurer l’optimisation et la pérennité des contrats d’approvisionnement (électricité, gaz, CO₂)
* Développer et valoriser des prestations de services liées aux marchés de l’énergie, contribuer à l’élaboration des offres clients en marché ouvert et assurer la cohérence globale entre stratégie commerciale, trading et gestion de l’énergie
* Représenter la direction et le Groupe auprès des partenaires et projets stratégiques, piloter les projets transversaux (trading, IT, conduite, systèmes d’information)

  


**Profil :**


* Diplôme d’ingénieur HES / EPF en électricité, mécanique, physique ou mathématiques, ou formation jugée équivalente, complété par une solide compréhension des marchés de l’énergie
* Minimum 5 ans d’expérience professionnelle dans un poste à responsabilités, avec une expérience confirmée en management dans la gestion de l’énergie et/ou le commodity trading
* Excellente connaissance du marché de l’énergie, des produits dérivés et du marché boursier de l’électricité, ainsi que de bonnes compétences financières, incluant la gestion des risques, la valorisation et le reporting
* Bonnes connaissances de la conduite d’installations en temps réel, de l’hydrologie, des outils informatiques (MS Office, bases de données, ETRM, outils de calcul) et solides compétences en gestion de projets et en conduite d’équipes
* Langue maternelle française ou allemande avec de très bonnes connaissances de l’autre langue et de l’anglais, doté·e d’une forte capacité d’analyse, d’un esprit stratégique et décisionnel, de talents de négociateur, de leadership et de résistance au stress

  


**Ce que nous vous offrons :**

* Un environnement évolutif et favorable à l’équilibre entre la vie professionnelle et privée
* Les prestations sociales d’une entreprise moderne, une équité de traitement, des possibilités de développement professionnel
* Un fort esprit de cohésion et une équipe fière de collaborer : « Ensemble pour l’énergie de demain »

  


**Besoin de renseignements complémentaires ?**



Contactez Johann Ruffieux, Directeur Energie électrique, au 026 352 54 82\\.

  



Intéressé·e ? Nous nous réjouissons de recevoir votre dossier de candidature complet

  


**Ressources Humaines**



Delia Cosereanu

title: Head of Business Operations
description:
Company Description
  
**MET International AG** (METI) was established in 2010 in order to consolidate and develop MET Group’s international natural gas sales and purchase portfolio, as well as to establish a trading arm for commodity lines.


**METI** is responsible for providing highly competitive supply structures to its gas and power sales affiliates, optimizing its power generation assets, managing the LNG portfolio, and trading around international positions.


The Head of Business Operations owns ETRM business processes and trade lifecycle support within Met International. The role provides strategic and operational leadership for the Trade Process Analyst team and acts as the primary business owner of Endur from a process, control and governance perspective.
  

  

This role focuses on ensuring a clear accountability for business ownership of the ETRM platform, ensuring effective governance, scalable operations, and high\\-quality delivery of business\\-led change within the organisation.


  
Job Description
  
* Ownership of the ETRM business processes and trade lifecycle
* Lead and manage the Trade Process Analyst team
* Provide Level 3 (L3\\) support ownership for complex business issues
* Act as the primary business owner for Endur\\-related processes and new product implementations
* Define and maintain controls across the trade lifecycle
* Prioritise and sponsor business\\-led change and enhancements
* Partner with IT Application Operations to ensure platform stability
* Represent the business in ETRM governance and steering forums
* Ensure effective use of business SMEs and reduce operational risk

  
Qualifications
  
* Extensive experience in energy trading operations or Middle Office
* Deep knowledge of ETRM platforms, preferably Endur
* Proven leadership and people management experience
* Strong understanding of trade lifecycle controls and risk management
* Ability to operate at both strategic and hands\\-on levels
* Excellent stakeholder management and decision\\-making skills

  
Additional Information
  
* Competitive remuneration
* Working in a dynamic international team
* High degree of responsibility and independence
* Friendly and modern working environment

title: Trade Process Analyst
description:
Company Description
  
**MET International AG** (METI) was established in 2010 in order to consolidate and develop MET Group’s international natural gas sales and purchase portfolio, as well as to establish a trading arm for commodity lines.


**METI** is responsible for providing highly competitive supply structures to its gas and power sales affiliates, optimizing its power generation assets, managing the LNG portfolio, and trading around international positions.


The Trade Process Analyst is responsible for supporting and owning ETRM business processes across the trade lifecycle. The role provides Level 3 business support for Endur, ensures accurate deal booking, and acts as a key interface between Trading, Middle Office, and IT Application Operations.
  

  

This role is critical in reducing reliance on senior SMEs for day\\-to\\-day support while enabling stable, scalable business operations within the ETRM target operating model.

Ensure end\\-to\\-end trade lifecycle integrity and control adherence
* Work closely with Trading, Risk, and Middle Office to resolve operational issues
  

Translate business requirements into clear functional specifications for IT

Qualifications

title: Senior Business Analyst / IT Project Manager - Endur
description:
Company Description
  
**MET Group** is an integrated European energy company, headquartered in Switzerland, with activities in natural gas and power, focused on multi\\-commodity wholesale, trading and sales, as well as energy infrastructure and industrial assets.


**MET Group** is represented in 21 countries: Albania, Austria, Belgium, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Bulgaria, Czech Republic, Croatia, France, Germany, Hungary, Italy, Poland, Romania, Serbia, Singapore, Slovakia, Spain, Switzerland, The Netherlands, Turkey and Ukraine.


**MET** **Group** is present in 33 national energy markets and 44 international trading hubs. The Group has a significant end\\-consumer presence in Belgium, Croatia, Italy, Hungary, Romania, Slovakia, Spain, and The Netherlands.


**MET** **Group** has 1350\\+ permanent staff. The company is owned 90% by MET employees and 10% by Keppel Infrastructure, a wholly owned subsidiary of Keppel Corporation \\*.


*\\* Listed on the Singapore Exchange*


  
Job Description
  
**Role purpose**

Serve as the central coordination and analytical point between Front Office, operational support teams, and IT functions to ensure seamless execution of business priorities. The role ensures operational readiness for new products and initiatives, drives process standardization, and actively contributes to the digital transformation of the Sales \\& Trading (S\\&T) landscape. In addition, the position acts as a key stakeholder in the ETRM landscape (with Endur as the core trading platform), ensuring that trade capture, valuation, risk, P\\&L, reporting, and downstream processes run reliably, consistently, and in compliance with internal controls and regulatory expectations. The role serves as the central point of accountability for S\\&T\\-wide coordination, reporting, and lifecycle governance, providing leadership across divisions and central functions to align ownership, standards, and priorities, and anchoring the development of a consistent operating and reporting framework across all divisions.


**Key responsibilities**

* Manage S\\&T level EoD delivery
	+ Oversee end\\-of\\-day processing, validations, position/risk availability and P\\&L delivery from Endur and connected systems
	+ Ensure data completeness, timeliness, and integrity across the full trade lifecycle
* Coordinate issue resolution on day\\-to\\-day issues across key internal applications and teams for STS in collaboration with Trading and wholesales Divisional IT team.
	+ Act as escalation point for production incidents affecting trade capture, pricing curves, settlements\\-relevant data, risk reporting, and valuation topic.
	+ Drive root\\-cause remediation rather than just workaround
* Prioritize and manage STS NPA (new product approval) process
	+ Support the operational readiness assessment in Endur for STS related structure in collaboration with Trading and wholesales Divisional IT team.:
		- trade capture model, risk representation, deal flow\\-through, booking controls, valuation models, settlement requirements, reporting impacts
	+ Secure that Front Office can book and risk\\-manage new structures in a fully controlled and supportable way for STS related transaction
* Represent S\\&T interests on prioritization forums
	+ Act as the voice of S\\&T users when changes are proposed (product changes, data model changes, interface changes, workflow automation)
	+ Translate trading/business needs into structured IT demand with clear business justification and operational impact
* Act as business owner or key stakeholder for core STS ETRM processes and data standards (CMDP/Riskdatamodel/ENDUR)
	+ Define and enforce golden\\-source logic (positions, curves, reference data, book hierarchy)
	+ Ensure consistency of processes and controls across books, desks and regions
	+ Sponsor and drive automation / straight\\-through processing initiatives in and around Endur for STS
* Support and guide the change agenda
	+ Make sure enhancements in Endur and the wider S\\&T architecture actually land in operations (i.e. are adopted, documented, and supported)

  
Qualifications
  
* 7–10 years in energy trading, operations, or ETRM support
	+ Direct exposure to front\\-to\\-back trade lifecycle in power, gas, emissions, certificates, structured products, or similar
* Strong understanding of trading products, deal lifecycle, and related processes
	+ Trade capture, validation, lifecycle events
	+ Pricing / valuation / curves
	+ Risk measures and Greeks
	+ P\\&L explain and attribution
	+ Settlements / invoicing inputs
* Hands\\-on experience with Endur
	+ Understanding of deal setup, portfolio / book structures, reference data, curves and market data setup, Endur workflows, and EoD batch / reporting chains
	+ Ability to challenge both Front Office and IT
* Proven experience bridging business and IT, ideally in a hybrid operations / BA role
	+ Able to translate trading asks into system change requirements
	+ Able to translate system constraints back into commercial / risk language
* Excellent communication, stakeholder management, and problem\\-solving skills
	+ Able to drive alignment between Front Office urgency and control / governance requirements
* Familiarity with process improvement and digital transformation methodologies
	+ Comfort working with automation, workflow tooling, dashboarding, data quality / data lineage topics
	+ Track record in standardizing, documenting, and scaling operational processes

  
Additional Information

title: Sr. Trading Engineer
description:
Cargill is committed to providing food and agricultural solutions to nourish the world in a safe, responsible, and sustainable way. Sitting at the heart of the supply chain, we partner with farmers and customers to source, make and deliver products that are vital for living.


Our 155,000 team members innovate with purpose, providing customers with life’s essentials so businesses can grow, communities prosper, and consumers live well. With over 160 years of experience as a family company, we look ahead while remaining true to our values. We put people first. We reach higher. We do the right thing—today and for generations to come.

**Job Purpose and Impact**
--------------------------



The Tech Lead / Development Lead – Corporate Risk Reporting (CRR) role serves as the single technical owner for the CRR platform, accountable for the end\\-to\\-end design, development, and technical integrity of the solution. The role ensures that risk logic, data ingestion, and user\\-facing reporting and analytics are implemented in a coherent, scalable, and correct manner across the full technology stack.

  

This position owns the technical interpretation and implementation of trading risk logic, with primary hands\\-on responsibility for SQL\\-based risk calculations and data layers. The role leads development across SQL, data ingestion, and frontend/backend streams, ensuring that positions, exposures, pricing, and P\\&L outputs are accurate, performant, and aligned with agreed business definitions.

  

Working closely with the Senior Business Analyst, Domain Modeler, Engineering Manager, and broader engineering teams, the role ensures that business intent is translated into robust technical designs and that delivery decisions balance correctness, performance, technical debt, and long\\-term platform sustainability. The role plays a critical part in delivering a trusted, enterprise\\-grade risk reporting platform for internal risk management users.

**Key Accountabilities**
------------------------


* **End\\-to\\-end technical ownership:**  

Acts as the single technical owner for the CRR platform, accountable for solution coherence, correctness, performance, and scalability across all development streams.
* **SQL risk logic leadership:**  

Leads the design and implementation of SQL\\-based risk logic, including base, semantic, and reporting data layers, with primary hands\\-on responsibility for complex transformations and performance tuning.
* **Cross\\-stream technical leadership:**  

Provides technical leadership across SQL developers, data engineers, and full stack engineers, ensuring alignment across ingestion, data layers, APIs, and user interfaces.
* **Risk data correctness and integrity:**  

Ensures consistency and correctness of positions, exposures, pricing, and P\\&L outputs across end\\-of\\-day and reporting use cases.
* **Architecture and design stewardship:**  

Guides and reviews architectural decisions across database, data ingestion pipelines, OpenSearch, and .NET/React\\-based UI and API layers.
* **Business and domain partnership:**  

Partners closely with the Senior Business Analyst and Domain Modeler to translate business requirements into implementable technical designs, providing feasibility assessment and technical guidance.
* **Technical risk and debt management:**  

Identifies, assesses, and proactively manages technical risks, performance bottlenecks, and technical debt to protect platform stability and long\\-term maintainability.
* **Delivery and production readiness:**  

Supports release planning, cutovers, and production readiness, ensuring data availability, performance validation, and operational stability.
* **Engineering standards and quality:**  

Defines and enforces standards for SQL development, data quality, lineage, DevOps and coding practices, and design patterns across the CRR engineering team.
* **Mentorship and capability uplift:**  

Mentors engineers across streams and contributes to raising overall engineering quality, consistency, and technical maturity within the CRR team.
**Qualifications**
------------------


**Qualifications:**

* Minimum requirement of 10 years of relevant work experience, typically reflecting 10–15\\+ years in engineering roles delivering data\\-intensive or analytics\\-driven platforms.
* Demonstrated experience owning end\\-to\\-end delivery of complex, multi\\-stream engineering solutions, with deep hands\\-on responsibility in SQL development.
* Strong experience delivering trading or risk platforms, preferably in commodities or capital markets environments.
* Proven ability to balance hands\\-on technical contribution with architectural leadership and cross\\-team influence.  

Strong communication skills with the ability to engage effectively with both technical and business stakeholders.

 **Required Skills:**  

**Mandatory:**  

* Expert\\-level SQL development and performance optimization
* Strong understanding of relational data modeling, data layers, and lineage
* Proven experience implementing complex risk or analytical logic in database\\-centric platforms
* Ability to reason across data ingestion, transformation, API, and UI consumption layers
* Strong system design skills spanning databases, services, and reporting interfaces
* Experience owning production readiness and end\\-to\\-end solution delivery
 **Good to Have:**  

* Experience with distributed large\\-scale operational databases
* Familiarity with OpenSearch or search\\-based analytics patterns
* Working knowledge of .NET backend services and React/AG Grid\\-based frontends
* Experience with SAP ODP, CTRMs, or enterprise data replication
* Exposure to cloud\\-native architectures and AWS\\-based platforms
**Our Offer**  

We provide a fast paced stimulating international environment, which will stretch your abilities and channel your talents. We also offer competitive salary and benefits combined with outstanding career development opportunities in one of the largest and most solid private companies in the world.

  

There are so many stories to tell of the great people that are helping the world to thrive at Cargill. You can find a few of the stories of diverse talent that make up the trading, merchandising and global trading analytics teams at Cargill. Access their stories here https://www.cargill.com/careers/trading\\-careers

 **Interested? Then make sure to send us your CV and cover letter in English today:**  

**Follow us on LinkedIn:** **https://www.linkedin.com/company/cargill**


Cargill is committed to being an inclusive employer. Click here to find out more https://careers.cargill.com/diversity/

title: Settlements Analyst (LNG, Gas and Power)
description:
### **Description**

  

The Settlements Analyst is responsible for the invoicing and settlement of LNG, Gas, Power, Emissions, and FX transactions. Raising invoices from the ETRM trading systems into SAP, ensuring payments are made on time and accurately allocated, are key elements of the role. The role requires strong teamwork and interpersonal skills due to regular interaction with a wide range of stakeholders. Excellent analytical and problem\\-solving skills are also essential.  

  

This is a 12\\-month FTC position.  

  

### **Key Responsibilities**

  

* Manage physical trade invoicing and settlement in line with industry Master Agreement standards and definitions.
* Confirm pricing with counterparties and issue both provisional and final sales invoices.
* Ensure settlement timelines align with payment due dates outlined in Master Agreements.
* Oversee timely receipt and payment of funds, liaising with Treasury, Compliance, and Front Office, and escalating or resolving issues as required.
* Process secondary costs for Gas, Power, and LNG, including transportation, LNG inspections, and brokerage fees.
* Ensure brokerage charges are accurately reflected in ETRM systems and that all invoicing is current.
* Prepare weekly cash flow forecasts for Treasury, covering physical purchase and sale activity.
* Manage spot physical exchange trade validation for Power and Gas.
* Run the OTC margining process via Credit Cube, requiring a solid understanding of margining principles.
* Collaborate closely with Legal, providing settlement input and review for Master Agreements and structured contracts.
* Build strong working relationships with traders, operators, and wider business teams to resolve disputes and ensure accurate, timely settlement.
* Proactively investigate and resolve third\\-party settlement disputes.
* Support month\\-end close activities in partnership with Accounting.
* Contribute to IT change initiatives and projects by identifying process improvements and raising system enhancement requests.
* Support counterparty setup in ETRM systems, ensuring all required controls and governance standards are met.

  

### **Skills, Knowledge and Expertise**

  

* Minimum: A level or Accounting vocational qualification
* Proven relevant experience, with thorough understanding of the settlement process and industry related compliance requirements.
* Settlement experience in LNG, Power and Gas is preferred
* Proficient in Microsoft Office and trading/accounting system (SAP experience definitely is a plus)
* Excellent team working and networking skills
* Possess good interpersonal and communication skills
* Energetic, enthusiastic, positive and proactive

  

### **Benefits**

  

The role offers a competitive salary commensurate with experience, as well as the opportunity to be awarded discretionary bonuses based on performance and a comprehensive benefits package including private medical insurance, travel insurance and dental insurance, annual gym reimbursement scheme, 10% contributory pension scheme, and 25 day yearly holiday allowance.### **About Petroineos Trading Limited**


  

Petroineos Trading Limited comprises trading and refining joint ventures between PetroChina International (London) Company Limited and INEOS. Established in 2011, Petroineos is one of Europe’s leading International Integrated Energy Trading Companies.
  

  

Our highly experienced teams trade a comprehensive range of energy products, supported by a network of professional teams across the globe, enabling our customers to benefit from our ability to leverage our shareholders’ global network. Trading is carried out by three divisions: Crude, Refined Products, and Low Carbon Solutions.  

  

To discover more about the company, click here.

title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
**Join us, be part of more.**

  

We’re so much more than an energy company. We’re a family of brands revolutionising how we power the planet. We're energisers. One team of 21,000 colleagues that’s energising a greener, fairer future by creating an energy system that doesn’t rely on fossil fuels, whilst living our powerful commitment to igniting positive change in our communities. Here, you can find more purpose, more passion and more potential. That’s why working here is \\#MoreThanACareer. We do energy differently – we do it all. We make it, store it, move it, sell it and mend it.

 **About your team:**

  

At Centrica Energy, our mission is to move it.

  

We’re energy movers by nature. We’re a global renewable energy trading company which helps move energy from source to use – powering businesses, homes, and societies as they transition to a new sustainable energy future. If the idea of working to create a sustainable energy future also moves you, we may very well be the right place for you.


Centrica Energy is the global energy trading and logistics arm of Centrica Plc. We trade power, gas, LNG, and energy attributes and connect producers, suppliers and offtakers in the wholesale energy markets \\- and we provide our clients with the best route\\-to\\-market services available to the market today with physical and financial settlement approaches. In short, we call ourselves energy movers by nature.


We are looking for a **Senior Business Analyst**, to join us on our journey! Within this role you will be responsible for using Endur package and integrations to drive system design, implementation and improvements for function and workflows.

**How we work:**


We embrace ‘flexible first’ as our guiding principle for flexible and hybrid working, which balances work, the team, and the individual need for flexibility. This role is based out of our London office, close to Marble Arch, with the team typically coming in 3 days per week. There will also be an occasional requirement to travel to our Denmark offices (Aalborg and Copenhagen).

**Key roles and responsibilities:**

* Demonstrate success managing digital solutions in the ETRM space from ideation to launch, including engineering and operational quality
* Articulate technology\\-based solutions, present in new business situations and workshops, and sometimes navigate complex client situations
* Be the first point of contact to identify, manage and resolve requirement questions, dependencies, issues, and risks with the onshore and offshore team and business
* Provide front line technical support to end\\-users responding to issues related to Problem/Incident Management, Release/Deployment, Operational Readiness, Application Monitoring, Production Governance related to issues
* Prioritise competing demands and obtain buy\\-in from stakeholders
* Delivery of complex business and technology solutions, from solution design to end\\-to\\-end system implementation, in the ETRM space
* Develop and implement methodologies that maximize the flow of value and are deeply rooted in Agile, Lean, and continuous delivery principles
* Develop and implement procedures to improve communication, team engagement, and coordination around incident management and to reduce the business impact.

**The Person:**

* Understanding of end to end processes in the physical commodity, trading, or similar (financial services, investment banking) industry
* Strong understanding of OpenLink Endur platform and experience in using OpenLink development tools \\- either JVS or OpenComponents (JAVA)
* Ability to troubleshoot, support and maintain Endur instance
* Ability to create custom WebApps or interfaces to the ETRM system
* Good understanding of programming languages like Python and C\\+\\+
* Good database development either using Oracle PL/SQL
* Knowledge of DMS, Crystal Report, REST API, Apache Kafka, Apache Tomcat, etc technologies
* Knowledge of trading, STP, Risk and Operations process
* Good analytical skills \\- able to investigate, analyse and troubleshoot tasks
* Capacity to work autonomously and to communicate with the different stakeholders of the project
* Able to perform various phases of SDLC where essential – analysis, coding, review, testing, documentation, implementation and release management. Along with any troubleshooting /investigation / support task.
* Ability and desire to work in a fast moving trading environment to help the ETRM landscape get ahead of industry benchmarks.

**Why should you apply?**  

  

We’re not a perfect place – but we’re a people place. Our priority is supporting all of the different realities our people face. Life is about so much more than work. We get it. That’s why we’ve designed our total rewards to give you the flexibility to choose what you need, when you need it, making sure that you and your family are supported not only financially, but physically and emotionally too. Visit the link below to discover why we’re a great place to work and what being part of more means for you.  

  

https://www.morethanacareer.energy/centricaenergy

  

If you're full of energy, fired up about sustainability, and ready to craft not only a better tomorrow, but a better you, then come and find your purpose in a team where your voice matters, your growth is non\\-negotiable, and your ambitions are our priority.  




  

Help us, help you. We would love for you to share any information about yourself throughout our recruitment process so that we can better understand you and help shape your journey.

title: SDR (London)
description:
**Location: London, Southwark**


**Position Type: Full\\-time, Permanent**


**Work model: Hybrid (8 days in office per month)**


**Industry: Commodities \\& Energy**

 **About us:**



Founded in 1995, Zema Global Data Corporation empowers organizations to simplify complexity, reduce risk, and make faster, more confident decisions that drive measurable results. Over the past two years, Zema Global has accelerated its growth through strategic investment and acquisition to strengthen our global leadership. Together we’re helping our customers gain a Decisioning Advantage – one bold idea at a time. With a presence across global energy, commodity, and financial markets, Zema Global empowers customers to simplify complexity, reduce risk, and make faster, more confident decisions that drive measurable results.

  

At Zema Global, we Think Big, Make It Happen, and Win as One. We thrive on collaboration, creativity, and respect, united by a shared drive to innovate and deliver meaningful impact for our customers and communities. If you’re inspired by solving complex challenges and contributing to a culture that values purpose and performance, we invite you to join us.

 **Position overview:**



At Zema Global, we help energy and commodities organizations turn complex data into confident decisions. As a Sales Development Representative (SDR), you will play a critical role in connecting prospective customers with our data management and analytics solutions, helping to shape the very first stages of the customer journey.

  

This role is ideal for someone who is commercially curious, motivated by impact, and eager to build a career in B2B technology sales. You will work at the intersection of marketing, sales, and market intelligence \\- engaging senior stakeholders, uncovering meaningful business challenges, and generating high\\-quality opportunities for our sales team.

 **Key responsibilities:**


**Build pipeline \\& engage prospects**


* Generate qualified revenue pipeline by setting introductory meetings with target influencers and decision\\-makers across energy and commodities markets.
* Proactively identify and engage new and existing accounts through a combination of outbound calling, personalized email, and social outreach.
* Qualify inbound and outbound leads by understanding customer needs, priorities, and alignment with Zema Global’s solutions.

  


**Understand the market \\& customer challenges**


* Research prospect organizations, industry trends, and use cases to deliver relevant and thoughtful outreach.
* Develop a strong understanding of Zema Global’s products, data capabilities, and the challenges faced by energy and commodities businesses.
* Capture insights from prospect conversations and share feedback with Sales and Marketing to refine messaging and targeting.

  


**Collaborate \\& Execute**


* Partner closely with Sales Executives to ensure a seamless handover of qualified opportunities.
* Work with Marketing on campaigns, follow\\-up strategies, and lead engagement across the funnel.
* Collaborate with cross\\-functional teams, contributing to a culture of continuous learning and shared success.
* Operate with Discipline \\& Curiosity
* Maintain accurate and up\\-to\\-date records in CRM and sales engagement tools.
* Manage time and priorities effectively in a fast\\-paced, high\\-growth environment.
* Test new approaches, learn from outcomes, and share best practices with the wider SDR and sales team.

  


**What we’re looking for:**


* Experience in B2B SaaS sales development, business development, or a similar customer\\-facing commercial role, with exposure to mid\\-market and enterprise organizations.
* Hands\\-on experience using HubSpot as a primary CRM is essential, including managing leads, activities, pipeline reporting, and data quality; experience with additional sales tools is a plus.
* Industry knowledge of the energy and commodities markets, with an understanding of data management, analytics, and/or ETRM solutions, and how these support commercial, trading, and operational teams.
* Confidence engaging and communicating with senior stakeholders across commercial, technology, and operations functions in a clear, credible, and consultative manner.
* A strong ability to assess prospect needs, personalize outreach, and identify high\\-quality opportunities aligned to complex and data\\-driven business challenges.
* Experience planning and executing structured outbound and inbound prospecting activity, with a focus on consistency, quality, and measurable pipeline impact.
* Curiosity about market dynamics, regulatory change, and evolving customer needs within energy and commodities, using this insight to improve engagement and messaging.
* Familiarity with sales engagement and data tools such as Apollo, LinkedIn Navigator, Salesforce, or similar platforms (experience working with analytics\\- or data\\-led SaaS products is a plus).
* A proactive and adaptable mindset, comfortable operating in a fast\\-paced, high\\-growth environment and continuously testing new approaches to improve results.
* A collaborative and coachable attitude, with a strong desire to develop your sales skills and grow your impact at Zema Global.

  


**Desirable:**


* Bachelor’s degree in business, Marketing, or related field.
* Language skills (Spanish / German / French)

  


**Our benefits (UK):**


* Competitive Salary
* Private Medical Insurance (Health \\& Dental)
* Life Insurance
* Group Income Protection
* Eligible for discretionary performance\\-based bonus
* Hybrid Working
* 25 Days Annual Leave \\+ Public Holidays.
* Professional Development \\& Learning Opportunities
* Fun Culture \\& Regular Socials

  


**How to Apply:**



Please send your CV highlighting your relevant experience (we only accept CVs in English). Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. No agency submissions, please.

 **\\*\\*\\* No visa sponsorship is available for this position \\*\\*\\***


**Equality and Diversity:** Zema Global is committed to diversity and inclusion. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals and do not discriminate based on race, gender, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected status.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Main purpose
We are seeking a Software Engineer to support the development and optimization of an ETRM (Energy Trading and Risk Management) system, with the focus on defining, designing and implementing software solutions in the context of Trafigura’s current ETRM platform’s extensibility capabilities. Based in our London office, this role is expected to closely collaborate with Trafigura’s team and in the context of stablished delivery cycle to support efficient solutions are provided in a time to market that is aligned with the ongoing business needs that are reflective of their growth and expansion.
This is a key role within the team, responsible proposing, implementing, supporting and validating software solutions, promoting coding best practices, and contributing to the success of the overall development lifecycle.
Key responsibilities* Propose and Document Software Designs for solutions or new functionalities
* Implement Software designs while following the development and delivery cycle
* Implement new and enhance existing Horizon Class Events
* Develop and integrate new components using C\\# and .NET Core as main language
* Design and implement robust database solutions using SQL and relational database principles

* Write clean, maintainable code following industry best practices and coding standards
* Support the testing execution team and automated testing activities
* Set up and configure application infrastructure to support Application system requirements
* Utilise PowerShell scripting for automation and system administration tasks
* Monitor system reliability and scalability, proactively addressing potential issues
* Drive performance improvements across the development lifecycle

Required qualifications* Minimum 8 years’ experience in software engineering with focus on software development, software development cycle
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
* Proficiency in C\\# and .Net Core development
* Strong knowledge of SQL and relation database design
* Experience configuring and extending Allegro Horizon
* Demonstrable experience on Horizon Class events Development deployment and debugging.
* Solid understanding of web services and API integrations
* Clear understanding of base concepts of financial and physical trading life cycle
* Strong technical ownership and leadership, with accountability for solution design, code reviews, and mentoring of junior developers
* Clear focus on non\\-functional requirements, including performance, scalability, security, and operational resilience
* Demonstrated experience working with distributed teams across multiple locations and time zones, including effective asynchronous collaboration and handovers
* Strong emphasis on technical documentation, design artefacts, and knowledge sharing across teams
* Experience with Agile methodologies
* Proficient English, native or equivalent to C2 level oral and written skills


Preferred qualifications* Experience developing solutions or participating in implementation of ETRM projects for Energy companies or Energy commodity trading companies. Particularly in the Gas and Power space
* Hands\\-on experience supporting production systems, encompassing incident resolution and root cause analysis
* Knowledge over other development languages


Attributes for success* Interpersonal skills to be a great teammate
* Extended experience on development life cycle
* Understanding Energy trading life cycle
* Interest and capability to interact with technical and non\\-technical team members or users.
* Strong technical ownership and leadership, with accountability for solution design, code reviews, and mentoring of junior developers
* Clear focus on non\\-functional requirements, including performance, scalability, security, and operational resilience
* Demonstrated experience working with distributed teams across multiple locations and time zones, including effective asynchronous collaboration and handovers
* Hands\\-on experience supporting production systems, encompassing incident resolution and root cause analysis
* Strong emphasis on technical documentation, design artefacts, and knowledge sharing across teams


Department overview
Trafigura is committed to building and maintaining world class IT applications and infrastructure. The Trading IT group directly supports the Trafigura trading business, and this business has started a far\\-reaching programme to enhance and improve its trading applications using an innovative architecture to support business growth across the full range of business lines and geographies, and to enable the sharing of systems across different businesses.
These programmes are aimed at delivering functional capabilities, enhancements and technical infrastructure upgrades to enable continued business growth and enhanced profitability for the firm.
Equal opportunity employer

We do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or other employment practices for reasons of race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, marital or veteran status, medical condition or handicap, disability, or any other legally protected status.

title: Model Validation - Specialist
description:
**What you’ll be doing**

The candidate will participate in the assignments of the Group validating Models used in the valuation and risk measurement of Financial Portfolios, Assets and Instruments as well as the formulation of Input and Output information from the Global Energy markets. She or he is based in London, Houston, Singapore or Bangalore.

The analyst bridges seven areas:

* Assessment that a Model is “fit for purpose”
* Analysis of Model algorithms applying different validation techniques which include using challenger models internally built or procured externally
* Review of process underlying a Model including inputs and outputs flows
* Determination of adjustments to Model required to mitigate weaknesses
* Maintenance and extension of the Model Validation policy
* Inventory of Models used within the Risk Management Function (RMF) and without as requested
* Collection of code and documentation for successive Model versions

The different professionals involved in these activities along with the Group manager will intervene on a Model at 3 levels:

* The Scientist Senior Analyst will investigate the conceptual underpinnings of the Model and audit the embedded algorithms with a view to identifying limitations to the model and remediations
* The Engineer Analyst will consider the cases where the Model is applied and formulate test scripts to verify that inputs \\& parameters are used appropriately to generate outputs that are properly understood
* The Technician Junior Analyst will compile the information related to the Model and execute test scripts

Engagement of the Model Validation specialists with external Stakeholders will be very significant starting with other groups in the RMF such as Quantitative Analysis, Portfolio Valuation, Market Risk Management Advisory, Market Risk Operations, Risk Management Transformation and Credit Risk Management Advisory.

They will also interface ongoing with Commercial Traders, Originators \\& Structurers, Quantitative Analysts \\& Research Analysts as well as Back\\-Office and Information Technology Departments.

The Model Validation specialists also participate in educational efforts with benefits across RMF and the firm. ​

The skills required for the tasks include:

* The application of advanced financial mathematics to formulate algorithms used for valuation and risk measurement of exotic derivatives and assets such as Natural Gas \\& Oil Storage, LNG \\& Freight Cargos, Transport, Transmission and Power Generation as well as calculate with various methodologies portfolio metrics like Market Value at Risk (Var), Credit Potential Future Exposure (PFE) and Economic Capital
* Industry experience in structuring and balancing these deals and portfolios while selecting the appropriate inputs \\& parameters for modeling
* Abilities in multiple software tools to analyze the code underlying a Model and build challenger Models by transforming algorithms quickly in working applications
* Data analysis techniques allowing to follow data extraction, transformation and interfacing from numerous corporate systems into a Model application
* Communication methods to explain the Model implications to Senior Management as well as Quantitative Specialists who built and are using the Model

**What you bring** 

* A degree in business administration, finance, economics, mathematics, engineering or information systems at the bachelor’s or above level for the Technician specialist and master’s to PhD for the Engineer and Scientist
* General knowledge of energy markets, natural gas, power, emissions, oil crude \\& products and LNG
* Preferably 5 \\-8 years of relevant experience in risk management in the Energy industry
* ​CQF, ERP, FRM and other related certifications are welcome
* Excellent critical thinking and problem\\-solving skills
* Strong analytical skills with attention to detailed data analysis and complex model configuration
* Ability to multi\\-task and accommodate organic changes in requirements for deliverables
* Ability to work as a team member and with all members of the organization. ​
* ​Ability to communicate complex technical ideas, regardless of the technical capacity of the audience
* Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite​, SharePoint and Teams
* Knowledge of SQL e.g. TOAD or GOLDEN, VBA independently or within Excel​, C\\# and .Net
* Experience with one or several analytical languages like Python, R, MatLab or SAS
* Usage of either QlikSense, QlikView, Spotfire, Power BI or Alteryx​
* Navigation in Energy Trading and Risk Management systems (ETRMs) OpenLink ENDUR, SunGard Nucleus, FIS Aligne, CubeLogic and using or connecting analytical libraries Lacima, Numerix, Allegro/FEA \\& Open Source Risk (OSR)
* Application processing in the Microsoft Azur Cloud and AWS​

**What we offer**

You bring your skills and experience to Shell and in return you work with talented, committed people on one of the most important challenges facing our planet. You’ll have the opportunity to develop the skills you need to grow in an environment where we value honesty, integrity, and respect for one another. You’ll be able to balance your priorities as you become the best version of yourself.

· Progress as a person as we work on the energy transition together.

· Continuously grow the transferable skills you need to get ahead.

· Work at the forefront of technology, trends, and practices.

· Collaborate with experienced colleagues with unique expertise.

· Achieve your balance in a values\\-led culture that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.

· Perform at your best with a competitive starting salary and annual performance related salary increase – our pay and benefits packages are considered to be among the best in the world.

· Take advantage of paid parental leave, including for non\\-birthing parents.

· Join an organisation working to become one of the most diverse and inclusive in the world. We strongly encourage applicants of all genders, ages, ethnicities, cultures, abilities, sexual orientation, and life experiences to apply.

· Grow as you progress through diverse career opportunities in national and

· international teams.

· Gain access to a wide range of training and development programs.

**We'd like you to know that Shell has a bold goal: to become one of the world’s most diverse and inclusive companies. You can get to know more about how we're working towards that goal, click here.** 

**We are committed to attracting a broader and more diverse pool of candidates. If this position doesn’t feel like the perfect fit for your qualifications right now, we’d still love to hear from you. Consider creating a profile in our Talent Community so we can keep you in mind for future opportunities that may align with your skills.**

**Shell in The World**

Shell UK remains one of the North Sea’s biggest producers, supplying around 10% of the UK’s total oil and gas needs. But perhaps the most recognizable face of Shell in the UK is our network of over 1,000 Shell\\-branded service stations.

In the years ahead, as the UK looks to strengthen energy security and deliver its 2050 net\\-zero goal, Shell UK aims to play a crucial role. We aim to be a major investor in the UK energy system by helping our customers decarbonize with a focus on transport and industry.

Job Type: Full\\-time

Work Location: In person

title: LNG Terminal Operator
description:
Welcome to ConocoPhillips, where innovation and excellence create a platform for opportunity and growth. Come realize your full potential here.


**Who We Are**

We are one of the world’s largest independent exploration and production companies, based on proved reserves and production of liquids and natural gas. With operations and activities in 13 countries, we explore for, develop, and produce crude oil and natural gas globally. We are challenged with an important job to safely find and deliver energy to the world. Our employees are critical to our success, and with them we power civilization.


We’re grounded by our SPIRIT Values – safety, people, integrity, responsibility, innovation, and teamwork. These values position us to deliver strong performance in a dynamic business – but not at all costs. We believe it’s not just what we do – it’s how we do it – that sets us apart.


**Fostering an Inclusive Work Environment**

To deliver superior performance, we create an environment that respects the contributions and differences of every individual. Wherever possible, we use these differences to drive competitive business advantage, personal growth and, ultimately, create business success.


**Job Summary**

The LNG Terminal and Cargo Operator is responsible for managing commercial and operational activities across LNG terminals and cargo operations. The role supports optimization of send‑out schedules, ensures compliance with contractual and regulatory requirements, coordinates vessel and terminal activities, and contributes to strategic initiatives that enhance portfolio value. This position requires strong analytical capabilities, effective stakeholder engagement, and the ability to manage multiple priorities in a dynamic environment.
**Position Overview**

Your responsibilities may include:


* Lead commercial operations for LNG regasification capacity across European terminals
* Identify and evaluate opportunities to expand LNG regasification capacity on a spot and term basis
* Negotiate, execute, and administer LNG regasification and capacity agreements
* Participate in LNG regasification capacity auctions and assess financial and operational implications
* Work with gas trading teams to optimize send‑out schedules and inventory to meet market and contractual requirements
* Support commissioning activities for LNG regasification terminals where the company participates as a foundation customer
* Develop and maintain strong working relationships with terminal owners, foundation customers, and new terminal operators
* Support DES cargo operations across the Atlantic region, including delivery into contracted LNG regasification terminals
* Coordinate with internal teams, including trading, chartering, scheduling, cargo operations, and ship operations to ensure accurate and timely cargo delivery
* Develop and maintain relationships with terminal operators, port and ship agents, cargo surveyors, and other external stakeholders
* Monitor regulatory and market developments affecting LNG operations and ensure compliance with applicable rules and standards
* Support implementation of operational systems, including ETRM and scheduling tools, and contribute to system and process improvements
* Support review and assessment of commercial agreements, including MSA and MSPA documents, to ensure alignment with LNG cargo and regasification operations
* Develop consistent operational processes to support a large and complex LNG portfolio

Basic/Required:


* Legally authorized to work in the United Kingdom
* Bachelor’s degree or higher in Economics, Business, Engineering, or a related field, or foreign equivalent
* 10 or more years of experience in LNG cargo operations, LNG regasification terminal operations, scheduling, or related LNG value chain activities

Preferred:


* Experience supporting commercial operations across the LNG value chain
* Experience using operational and industry tools used in LNG operations
* Experience supporting digital transformation or system implementation projects in energy markets
* Experience building relationships with internal and external stakeholders
* Experience with commercial contract review and optimization
* Advanced level of knowledge of LNG regasification contracts and European gas market operations
* Knowledge of LNG‑to‑power operations and integrated energy solutions
* Analytical and economic modeling capabilities
* Ability to manage multiple priorities in complex and fast‑paced environments
* Takes ownership of actions and commitments, ensuring ethical and timely decisions
* Builds positive relationships based on trust and seeks collaboration across organizational boundaries to achieve goals
* Builds effective solutions based on available information and makes timely decisions that are safe and ethical
**Apply By:**

Feb 3, 2026
**Sponsorship:**

ConocoPhillips’ sponsorship for employment authorization in the country where this job is located is available for this position.
**EEO:**

ConocoPhillips is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Main purpose
We are seeking a Software Engineer to support the development and optimization of an ETRM (Energy Trading and Risk Management) system, with a focus on application setup, continuous integration, and continuous delivery (CI/CD) processes. Based in our London office, this role will be instrumental in ensuring robust integration of new features and maintaining a reliable and scalable system to support ongoing business growth.
This is a key role within the team, responsible for driving performance improvements, promoting coding best practices, and contributing to the success of the overall development lifecycle.  

Key responsibilities* Develop and integrate new components using C\\# and .NET Core
* Design and implement robust database solutions using SQL and relational database principles
* Build and maintain web services and API integrations to support trading operations
* Write clean, maintainable code following industry best practices and coding standards
* Set up and configure application infrastructure to support Application system requirements
* Utilise PowerShell scripting for automation and system administration tasks
* Provide improvements to existing processes to optimise system performance to support business growth
* Maintain continuous integration and continuous delivery pipelines and support the CICD process
* Monitor system reliability and scalability, proactively addressing potential issues
* Drive performance improvements across the development lifecycle
* Work closely with Windows Server administration teams, vendors, and internal application teams
* Collaborate with outsourced IT service providers to deliver integrated solutions
* Participate actively in Agile ceremonies and contribute to sprint planning and retrospectives
* Communicate technical concepts effectively to both technical and non\\-technical stakeholders


Required qualifications* Minimum 5 years experience in software engineering with a strong infrastructure and integration focus.
* 5 years experience in C\\# and .Net Core development
* Strong knowledge of SQL and relation database design
* Solid understanding of web services and API integrations
* Experience with infrastructure setup and application deployment
* Experience with Agile methodologies
* Excellent English, native or equivalent to C2 level oral and written skills


Preferred qualifications* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
* Additional experience in Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery integrations preferred.
* Knowledge over Powershell and windows setup preferred.


Attributes for success* Successfully integrating the team and proactively managing their technical needs
* Managing the development landscape
* Successfully help deliver the applications required for the system.


Department Overview
Trafigura is committed to building and maintaining world class IT applications and infrastructure. The Trading IT group directly supports the Trafigura trading business, and this business has started a far\\-reaching programme to enhance and improve its trading applications using an innovative architecture to support business growth across the full range of business lines and geographies, and to enable the sharing of systems across different businesses.  

These programmes are aimed at delivering functional capabilities, enhancements and technical infrastructure upgrades to enable continued business growth and enhanced profitability for the firm.
Equal opportunity employer
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and take pride in a diverse workforce! We do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or other employment practices for reasons of race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, marital or veteran status, medical condition or handicap, disability, or any other legally protected status.
CV
Please make sure that you submit your CV in English
